_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 16:53:38 using v2.0
title: How has the number of timely antenatal assessments changed?
analysis_commentary: The ratio of women who had their first appointment before 12 weeks and six days has generally increased over time from Quarter 1 2010/11 (0.85) to Quarter 4 2011/12 (0.95). There also appears to be an annual pattern in the data where the ratios in Quarter 1 are lower than the other quarters of the same year. Quarter 1 corresponds to antenatal appointments in April to June and maternities in October to December of the same year; we explore this relationship more in the next graph.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Maternity (Vital signs)
